str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Plural of an apparently primary word; ten thousand; by extension, innumerably many.
A boy's guardian or tutor, a slave who had charge of the life and morals of the boys of a family, not strictly a teacher.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From a variation of genos; to procreate; figuratively, to regenerate.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.
